page.title: 12Children's Games-Conkers
page.content: by Ron McGinn Conkers are the strong nut fruit which are produced by the horse-chestnut tree. A hole is drilled through the conker, a string threaded throughthe hole, and a knot tied at the end. Two players compete, and each try to break the other opponent's conker by swinging his conker at the other conker, now hanging from the other person's hand, as hard as he can. A conker can be made stronger by soaking it in vinegar and leaving it in the sun, or by cooking it in the oven for two minutes.
